question: You successfully passed a job interview. You are expected to start on November 15, but you will not be available on that date. Write a letter to you new boss, explaining your situation, expressing your concern and suggesting a solution
text: I had recently cleared the interview for the post of Software Engineer at Ecolab, but I am writing to inform you now that I will not be able to join the organization on 15th November due to some medical emergency in my family.

Last week, my mother was diagnosed with tuberculosis, and she is struggling with her health since then. As I am the only person to look after her, it will not be possible for me to join on the scheduled date since I do not expect her to recover by then.

I am extremely concerned with the lack of speed of her recovery. I have had consultations with the doctor who believe that it will take her 2 more weeks to recover. She will be on medication till then and will need my continuous support.

Due to this, I will be available to join the company only by 29th November. To make up for the time lost, I will be devoting 2 hours extra daily in order to meet my deliverables. I have communicated the same to the HR and she has acknowledged my situation.
I apologize for the inconvenience caused and thank you for your consideration.

error_list.error_des: The word daily doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
